title: Thunderbird stops synchronizing my gmail IMAP inbox
content:
I've been using Thunderbird for well over a decade now. For many years I had zero issues, but a few years ago my troubles began.

For some reason at some time during the day, Thunderbird will stop automatically synchronzing my inbox and folders. It's really frustrating because I never know when it happens, but after a few hours I will notice "I haven't gotten any messages in a while. " This happens at least twice a week. Sometimes I might not realize it until much, much later, and by then I've missed dozens upon dozens of email messages.

At first this happened when I was still using POP on a gmail inbox. The only way I could trigger Thunderbird to start re-syncing again was to completely shut down Thunderbird and reopen it. It gets really annoying having to do this so frequently.

At some point, I decided to convert to IMAP. This works only marginally better. Thunderbird still occasionally stops syncing, but usually I just have to navigate to a different folder and then back to Inbox, to get it to start again. But it may take several minutes before the messages start flowing in.

I can't see that there are any errors happening, but maybe I don't know where to look. I'm perfectly happy to look for error logs or whatever to help troubleshoot the issue.

I really don't like the gmail interface on Chrome, and the phone app is even worse, and would hate to have to stop using Thunderbird. But with gmail I never have to worry if my inbox is current, and I'm beyond tired of missing email messages.

Has anyone experienced this before or could help with advice on figuring this out?

Thanks so much!

P.S. I'm currently on 102.11.0 (64-bit) on MacOS Big Sur. I have auto-updates turn on, so my Thunderbird install is always current.
creator: cal.vino
